task_name: teach my parent to use video calls
task_description: Task to teach my parent to use video calls

must_have: Discuss privacy settings and how to manage them
Use a simple and user-friendly video calling app
Provide written instructions or a cheat sheet for reference
nice_to_have: Introduce them to virtual backgrounds for privacy or fun
Choose a user-friendly video calling app like Zoom or Skype
Encourage them to personalize their video call settings (e.g., brightness, contrast)
Show them how to react with emojis or reactions during calls
deal_breakers: Fear of making mistakes during the call
Confusion about audio and video settings

decision_factors: Availability of devices for video calls
Need for frequent communication with family or friends
Willingness of the parent to learn new skills
Accessibility of user-friendly video calling applications

technical: A device that has a screen and can connect to the internet, whatever that means
I think it should have some kind of camera, but I'm not sure what kind
Something modern that works well, I guess
non_technical: A calm environment for learning, but also maybe a busy one for practice
Some kind of guide, like a paper or a website, but I'm not sure what it should say
I think they need to be comfortable, but also focused

must_meet: They should be able to make a call without getting confused about buttons, I hope
They need to know how to mute, I heard that's important but not sure why
There should be no issues with connecting, whatever that involves
should_meet: If they can change backgrounds, that would be nice, but not necessary
It would help if they could remember how to use the app without looking at notes all the time
Being able to share their screen might be good, I think
nice_to_meet: They could learn how to react during calls, but I don't know if that's essential
Knowing how to add friends in the app would be cool, but also confusing
If they felt confident using the app after a few tries, that would be great
